rows.summary: When he finds out that his work superiors host a dinner celebrating the idiocy of their guests, a rising executive questions it when he's invited, just as he befriends a man who would be the perfect guest.

rows.title: 12 Monkeys
rows.cast: Bruce Willis, Madeleine Stowe, Brad Pitt
rows.tagline: The future is history.
rows.summary: In a future world devastated by disease, a convict is sent back in time to gather information about the man-made virus that wiped out most of the human population on the planet.

rows.title: An Education
rows.tagline: A screenplay by Nick Hornby
rows.summary: A coming-of-age story about a teenage girl in 1960s suburban London, and how her life changes with the arrival of a playboy nearly twice her age.

rows.title: Angels and Insects
rows.cast: Mark Rylance, Kristin Scott Thomas, Patsy Kensit
rows.tagline: An elegant seduction. An erotic deception. A stunning revelation.
rows.summary: In the 1800s a British naturalist marries into a family of Victorian aristocrats who are not what they seem.

rows.title: Creation
rows.cast: Paul Bettany, Jennifer Connelly, Ian Kelly
rows.tagline: The way he saw the world changed it forever.
rows.summary: English naturalist Charles Darwin struggles to find a balance between his revolutionary theories on evolution and the relationship with religious wife, whose faith contradicts his work.

rows.title: Adam
rows.cast: Hugh Dancy, Rose Byrne, Peter Gallagher
rows.tagline: A story about two strangers, one a little stranger than the other.
rows.summary: Adam, a lonely man with Asperger's Syndrome, develops a relationship with his upstairs neighbor, Beth.

rows.title: Bleak House
rows.cast: Anna Maxwell Martin, Carey Mulligan, Gillian Anderson, Denis Lawson
rows.tagline: Shake me up, Judy!
rows.summary: A suspenseful tale about the injustices of the 19th-century English legal system.

rows.title: Lone Star
rows.cast: Chris Cooper, Elizabeth Peña, Stephen Mendillo
rows.tagline: Don't ask a question if you don't want the answer.
rows.summary: When the skeleton of his murdered predecessor is found, Sheriff Sam Deeds unearths many other long-buried secrets in his Texas border town.

rows.title: A Bridge Too Far
rows.cast: Sean Connery, Ryan O'Neal, Michael Caine, Gene Hackman, Athony Hopkins, Elliott Gould
rows.tagline: his is a story you will tell your grandchildren; and mightily bored they'll be.
rows.summary: An historic telling of the failed attempt to capture several bridges to Germany in World War II in a campaign called Operation Market-Garden.

rows.title: Double Jeopardy
rows.cast: Ashley Judd, Tommy Lee Jones, Bruce Greenwood
rows.tagline: Murder isn't always a crime.
rows.summary: A woman framed for her husband's murder suspects he is still alive; as she has already been tried for the crime, she can't be re-prosecuted if she finds and kills him.

rows.title: Timer
rows.cast: Emma Caulfield, Michelle Borth, John Patrick Amedori
rows.tagline: You can't hurry love.
rows.summary: Staring down the barrel of thirty and tired of waiting for true love to show up, Oona breaks her own rules and falls for a charming and inappropriately young supermarket clerk.

rows.title: Away We Go
rows.cast: John Krasinski, Maya Rudolph, Allison Janney
rows.tagline: You have to be willing to make a family out of whatever you have.
rows.summary: A couple expecting their first child travel around the U.S. to find a perfect place to start their family. Along the way, they have misadventures and connect with an assortment of odd people.

rows.title: A Serious Man
rows.cast: Michael Stuhlbarg, Richard Kind, Sari Lennick
rows.tagline: No Jews were harmed in the making of this motion picture.
rows.summary: A Midwestern professor, watching his life suddenly unravel, seeks meaning and answers but seems to remain stalled.

rows.title: I Sell the Dead
rows.cast: Dominic Monaghan, Ron Perlman, Larry Fessenden
rows.tagline: Never trust a corpse.
rows.summary: With only a few hours to go before his date with the guillotine, an 18th century professional graverobber tells his life story to a priest.

rows.title: I Love You, Phillip Morris
rows.cast: Jim Carrey, Ewan McGregor, Leslie Mann
rows.tagline: Do some time with the one you love.
rows.summary: A con artist meets the love of his life in prison, but after his release his criminal hijinks make it difficult to maintain a relationship.

rows.title: Made in Dagenham
rows.cast: Sally Hawkins, Bob Hoskins, Miranda Richardson
rows.tagline: In 1968, it's a man's world. But not for much longer.
rows.summary: A British auto worker refuses to tolerate gender inequality any longer and leads a strike by her fellow machinists for equal pay.

rows.title: Million Dollar Baby
rows.cast: Hilary Swank, Clint Eastwood, Morgan Freeman
rows.tagline: There is magic in fighting battles beyond endurance.
rows.summary: A hardened trainer works with a determined woman in her attempt to establish herself as a prize fighter.

rows.title: Red Dragon
rows.cast: Anthony Hopkins, Edward Norton, Ralph Fiennes
rows.tagline: To understand evil, you must seek its origin.
rows.summary: A retired FBI agent with psychological gifts is asked to help track down 'The Tooth Fairy', a serial killer; aiding him is imprisoned criminal genius Hannibal Lecter.

rows.title: The King's Speech
rows.cast: Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter
rows.tagline: When God couldn't save the king, the queen turned to someone who could.
rows.summary: The story of King George VI of Britain, his impromptu ascension to the throne, and the speech therapist who helped the uncertain monarch become worthy of it.

rows.title: Twenty Bucks
rows.cast: Linda Hunt, Brendan Fraser, Elisabeth Shue, William H. Macy, Steve Buscemi, Christopher Lloyd
rows.tagline: When you pass the buck, the last thing you expect is change.
rows.summary: A $20 bill weaves in and out of the lives of a homeless woman, an aspiring writer, a stripper, two thieves, and teenage chef.

rows.title: Leaving Las Vegas
rows.cast: Nicolas Cage, Elisabeth Shue
rows.tagline: Until death do them part.
rows.summary: An alcoholic Hollywood screenwriter who has lost everything arrives in Las Vegas to drink himself to death. There, he meets and forms an uneasy friendship and non-interference pact with a prostitute.
